name: OpenELEC Dev Update
body:
![Icon](https://raw.github.com/LS80/script.openelec.devupdate/master/icon.png)

**OpenELEC has a built-in update mechanism for official releases but not for development builds. For those of us willing to test new builds, report bugs, and follow through with the testing, this is an easy way to manually switch between builds, without leaving the XBMC interface. When a newer build is available at the specified source URL, a notification will be shown to enable you to install the update.**

**The add-on will download the (bzip compressed) tar file and extract the SYSTEM and KERNEL update images, and the associated md5 checksum files, into the /storage/.update folder.**

**PLEASE BE AWARE THAT DEVELOPMENT BUILDS OFTEN HAVE MAJOR BUGS. YOU MAY EXPERIENCE FREQUENT CRASHES OR OTHER PROBLEMS WHEN USING THESE BUILDS. IT IS ADVISED TO BACKUP THE USERDATA FOLDER BEFORE UPDATING.**

Please note that this is not an official OpenELEC add-on, so don't ask for support from the OpenELEC team. If you have any comments or questions or suggestions for improvement, please post on this [OpenELEC forum thread](http://openelec.tv/forum/128-addons/49855).

-----------------------------

[Changelog](https://raw.github.com/LS80/script.openelec.devupdate/master/changelog.txt)

## Installation

1. Install my XBMC repository from [xbmc.repo.leopold.zip](http://goo.gl/csQU8h).
1. Install **OpenELEC Dev Update** from **Leopold's Add-ons** under **Program Add-ons**.

Installing this way will ensure that the add-on is kept up-to-date as I push out updates to the repository.

## Reporting Issues

If you get a script error or other problem please raise an [issue](https://github.com/LS80/script.openelec.devupdate/issues/new). If you can reproduce the problem then please include a debug log, by following these steps:

* [Turn on XBMC debugging](http://wiki.xbmc.org/index.php?title=Log_file#Enable_Debugging).
* Turn on the 'Debug' option in the add-on advanced settings.
* Restart XBMC to start a clean log.
* Run the add-on again to reproduce the error.
* Upload the debug log. There are a couple of ways:
 1. Log in via ssh and run pastebinit ~/.xbmc/temp/xbmc.log
 1. Use the add-on "XBMC Log Uploader".
